alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 3:09AM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches. Winds gusting 35 to 55 mph, strongest near the mouth of the Columbia River Gorge. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, especially near the mouth of the Columbia River Gorge. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and some powerlines. The cold wind chills as low as 10 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions at times likely in Vancouver area during peak snowfall rates later this afternoon into this evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
